title: Beulah Land
description: Chapter One:HER NAME IN THE BEGINNING WAS RUHAMA WARNE. SHE HAD been born in a log-village in the Mountains of North Carolina, in what was then the Cherokee Nation. The village was named Crow Town, and was somewhere between the settlements of Murphy and Haynesville. The year of her birth was 1840, when the Federal troops under General Scott were engaged in herding the Cherokees off their lands and moving them west, so their country could be opened to white settlement.
author: H.L. Davis
